abstract: Borrowing by GE Capital has been a huge moneymaker for Wall Street, but much of that business could be going away.
snippet: Borrowing by GE Capital has been a huge moneymaker for Wall Street, but much of that business could be going away.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street will probably have to bid farewell to its fee darling, General Electric. The conglomerate has been the best corporate client for investment bankers over the last 15 years, spending some $5.1 billion for advice and assistance. Shrinking GE Capital will keep M.&A. practitioners busy for a while. Borrowing by that financial operation, however, has been the biggest moneymaker.

headline.main: General Electric’s Days as Wall Street’s Golden Goose May Be Numbered
